messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Need help with rasearch project
messages.msgSnippet: ... I would start with having a good look at the battle screens. Maybe somebody can point out to some website where some are reproduced? There are also many
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 1, 2005, at 3:30 AM, p p wrote:

> Both will do fine as long as its a first had account of a battle or a
> document of some sort.

I would start with having a good look at the "battle screens."
Maybe somebody can point out to some website where some are reproduced?
There are also many books in Japanese that describe the painting and
the battles in detail.

cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Need help with rasearch project
messages.msgSnippet: Translated to english would be nice. p p  wrote: Both will do fine as long as its a first had account of a battle or a document of
messages.messageBody:
Translated to english would be nice.

p p <scubastevenson@...> wrote:
Both will do fine as long as its a first had account of a battle or a document of some sort.

Cepo <cepo@...> wrote:On Mar 30, 2005, at 6:19 PM, Scuba Stevenson wrote:

> Im doing a research project and I need to know where I can find
> Primary documents, on the samuri's rules of engagement, or the
> conduct in war. the documents need to be from primary sources about
> the way they conducted themselves in war, or how they were to treat
> the enemy,the prisoners( If they took any or not ), or how the
> civilans were treated. thanks for help send ideas to
> scubastevenson@...

Sources in English or in Japanese???

cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Need help with rasearch project
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks. Gillian Rubinstein  wrote: Surely primary sources presupposes Japanese?! Have you looked at Samurai, Warfare and the
messages.messageBody:
Thanks.

Gillian Rubinstein <gillian@...> wrote:> Surely "primary sources" presupposes Japanese?!

Have you looked at "Samurai, Warfare and the State in Early Medieval
Japan" by Karl Friday. (Routledge 2004). He considers several of these
issues. The book has an extensive bibliography of primary and
secondary sources. As to where you find these...I guess you just have
to use university libraries, andsearch on Google.

Good luck!

Gillian

messages.messageBody:
> Surely "primary sources" presupposes Japanese?!

Have you looked at "Samurai, Warfare and the State in Early Medieval

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Need help with rasearch project
messages.msgSnippet: ... I d assume he meant sources in Japanese, since he asked for primary sources. Not too many sources in English from the Sengoku Jidai. Though I must admit
messages.messageBody:
--- Cepo <cepo@...> wrote:
> On Mar 30, 2005, at 6:19 PM, Scuba Stevenson wrote:
>
> > Im doing a research project and I need to know
> where I can find
> > Primary documents, on the samuri's rules of
> engagement, or the
> > conduct in war. the documents need to be from
> primary sources about
> > the way they conducted themselves in war, or how
> they were to treat
> > the enemy,the prisoners( If they took any or not
> ), or how the
> > civilans were treated. thanks for help send ideas
> to
> > scubastevenson@...
>
> Sources in English or in Japanese???
>
> cepo

I'd assume he meant sources in Japanese, since he
asked for primary sources. Not too many sources in
English from the Sengoku Jidai. Though I must admit
I'm confused by his use of the term "Rules of
Engagement". That means something to me as an army
officer that wouldn't have affected the samurai.

Sengoku ROE: You see the enemy, go take his head! What
the hell are you standing here for???

Modern ROE: You can fire back if fired upon, but only
if you can clearly identify the enemy, and if he's not
hiding behind a church/mosque/important cultural site,
or using civilians as a shield, and you've got to use
the minimum force necessary to protect yourself, US
personnel, equipment, civilians, rare waterfowl, and
coral reefs. Spitballs are the recommended form of
non-deadly projectile.















I'd assume

messages.subject: Need help with rasearch project
messages.msgSnippet: Im doing a research project and I need to know where I can find Primary  documents, on the samuri s rules of engagement, or the conduct in war. the documents
messages.messageBody:
Im doing a research project and I need to know where I can find
Primary documents, on the samuri's rules of engagement, or the
conduct in war. the documents need to be from primary sources about
the way they conducted themselves in war, or how they were to treat
the enemy,the prisoners( If they took any or not ), or how the
civilans were treated. thanks for help send ideas to
scubastevenson@...
